official-title.#text:
To delay and phase-in increases in flood insurance
		  premium rates under the national flood insurance program for certain
		  properties, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text:
Flood Insurance Premium Relief Act of
			 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Temporary delay of
			 implementation and phase-in of premium rate increases for certain
			 properties

text.#text:
For any
			 property that is purchased after July 6, 2012, and before January 1, 2015, the
			 risk premium rate charged for flood insurance under the national flood
			 insurance program under the

during the
			 12-month period beginning upon such purchase, be the amount of such risk
			 premium rate chargeable for such property immediately before such purchase;
			 and

Flood Insurance Premium Relief Act of 2013/s:2/ss:a/p:2

text.#text:
thereafter, be a
			 rate that is not less than those estimated under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
with respect to any property, any increase in
			 the risk premium rate charged for flood insurance for such property that is a
			 result of
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Flood Insurance Premium Relief Act of 2013/s:2/ss:a/p:1/sp:A

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall be phased in over a 10-year period, at the
			 rate of 10 percent for each year following the expiration of such 12-month
			 period.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Flood Insurance Premium Relief Act of 2013/s:2/ss:a/p:1/sp:B

text.#text:
Upon the expiration of any 12-month period
			 referred to in

header.#text:
Properties with
			 new flood insurance rate maps

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, that is
			 covered by a flood insurance policy on the date of a covered flood insurance
			 rate map update, and for which the risk premium rate charged for flood
			 insurance for such property has increased, or will increase, as a result of
			 such update, the risk premium rate charged for flood insurance under the
			 national flood insurance program shall, during the 12-month period beginning
			 upon the effective date of such covered flood insurance rate map update, be the
			 amount of such risk premium rate chargeable for such property immediately
			 before the effective date of such update.

text.#text:
For any
			 property that is located in an area that is participating in the national flood
			 insurance program under the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
with respect to any property, any increase in the
			 risk premium rate charged for flood insurance for such property that is a
			 result of such covered flood insurance rate map update shall be phased in over
			 a 10-year period, at the rate of 10 percent for each year following the
			 expiration of such 12-month period.
